Use: General plain text. May be formatted in some way that is unspecified by this extension (i.e., a .txt file could contain comma separated values).
General data storage with rows and columns. Columns are separated by commas.
General data storage with rows and columns. Columns are separated by tabs.
Stores sequence data and quality scores.
Sequence Alignment Map format. Stores information about reads mapped to a reference genome.
Binary Alignment Map format. The compressed binary version of SAM format.
Another compressed format to store read mapping information.
Variant Call Format. Used to store information about variants inferred for a given sample(s). .vcf files are a specific type of tab delmited format.
Binary variant Call Format. The binary compressed verion of a VCF.
Stores coordinates of regions of interest. .bed files are a specific type of tab delimited format.
Stores annotation information from a genome. .gff files are a specific type of tab delimited format.
Stores annotation information from a genome. GTF is an earlier version of GFF, but still commonly used, notably by the Ensembl database. .gtf files are a specific type of tab delmited format.
